alert.note: Alert for Avery; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 12 at 10:56PM EDT until March 13 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Avery, Yancey and Mitchell Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold temperatures in the teens and single digits overnight will lead to slippery roadways in locations where snow covers the roads.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
